channel.title: Withstanding million-node botnets
channel.description:
http://www.usenix.org/events/nsdi08/tech/full_papers/dixon/dixon_html/index.html
that paper is quite long and technical and I only skimmed it before posting.
It seems you create your own botnet that defends against a ddos by filtering.. somehow... idk read the paper,
or the newscientist summary http://www.newscientist.com/article/dn13753-to-defeat-a-malicious-botnet-build-a-friendly-one.html
So what does it mean? The end of ddosing? I suspect newscientist might be getting a bit overexcited.

item.title: Withstanding million-node botnets
item.dc:creator: @inertia inertia
item.description:
@inertia wrote:

What does it mean by defending a botnet with a friendly one? It says nothing in the article about actually attacking anyone in response - this is just a cdn.

I thought Google had been doing this (or something similar) for years.

Read full topic

item.title: Withstanding million-node botnets
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

brb making botnet for facebook/myspace/4chan.

This just proves that the best form of defence is attack

Read full topic

item.title: Withstanding million-node botnets
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

T4_:

3 billion human lives ended on August 29th, 1997. The survivors of the nuclear fire called the war Judgment Day. They lived only to face a new nightmare: the war against the machines.

new judgment day is April 21st 2011

Read full topic

item.title: Withstanding million-node botnets
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

Obviously the solution is to create a counter-counter botnet that disables the friendly one.

Read full topic
